page.title: 07BROUGHTON BUILDINGS
page.content: The parish church of{St Mary}was built in the Middle Ages, but it was badly damaged in the{Great Fire}of Broughton in 1638, signs of this can still be seen on the stone work. The fire destroyed the centre of the village, which is why there are not many thatched cottages in Broughton. The{Dovecote}standing in the grounds of{St Mary's Church,}dates from 1340, but was rebuilt in 1684 with 482 nesting boxes in the thickness of the walls. The Broughton dovecote has a newly rebuilt{potence}or revolving ladder. The{Baptist Church}was founded in 1655; it was one of the earliest in the country. There are many other interesting and attractive buildings of many periods and styles along the{High Street}and its narrow side streets.
